test
Class ExprEvalTest

java.lang.Object
  test.ExprEvalTest
public class ExprEvalTest
extends java.lang.Object

Testing for ExprEval. All predefined test cases are stored in an XML document, and will be retrieved and performed during the testing procedure.

Version:
1.00 (Last update: March 4, 2008)
Author:
Dr. Wen-jun LI, Da LUO

Field Detail

fileName

public static java.lang.String fileName
The file name of the XML document, which storing all test cases.

total

public static int total
The total number of test cases.

warnings

public static int warnings
The number of warnings on test cases. A warning is the testing result indicating that if the expected output is a evaluated value, the running of the test case must output exactly the same value; if the expected output is an exception, the running of the test case must throw an exception, even the thrown exception is different from the expected one.

errors

public static int errors
The number of errors on test cases.

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Main entry to the testing of ExprEval.

Parameters:
args - a string indicating the name of an XML file, which contains data of test cases. If no args are provided, a default file name will be used.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when exceptions occurs while testing.

Run all test case specified in the Document.

Parameters:

Throws:
